pr_title: Add the provider config ID to ProviderMessageContent.

timeline.message: feat(provider): Add the provider config ID to ProviderMessageContent.

timeline.bodyText: This is the actual change here the rest are to remove finals.
timeline.author: psantos1113
psantos1113

timeline.bodyText: change to add a config ID.
timeline.author: psantos1113
psantos1113
psantos1113
psantos1113

timeline.bodyText: Since we are passing in the providerConfigId to all of these Builders, would it make more sense to pass in a ProviderMessageContent.Builder() instead with all of the common parts already filled in. Then use that as the base of all the individual ProviderMessageContent.Builder's we create?
timeline.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: This should still be the method that calls the build() method if we do go that route.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText: We should be able to get a real value for this at this point.
timeline.author: gkillough
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ public MessageResult testConfig(String configId, String destination, FieldAccess
                                                      .applyNotificationId(1L);
 
         ProviderMessageContent.Builder builder = new ProviderMessageContent.Builder()
-                                                     .applyProvider("Test Provider")
+                                                     .applyProvider("Test Provider", -1L)

replies.bodyText: This is the Global configuration of the email so we don't want any provider specific data to test the email channel's global configuration.
replies.author: psantos1113

timeline.bodyText: We should be able to get a real value for this at this point.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: This is just creating a test Issue for Jira.  We aren't using any provider specific data at this point to create a test issue.
replies.author: psantos1113

timeline.message: refactor: Encapsulate method arguments into a class for the builder to use.
refactor: Add the provider config ID to the content key.
fix(messages): Fix the message combiner to apply the correct provider parameters.
